word:
"The brethren of the Washington City church are poor, and while they will do all that they can, they are not able to carry the whole burden. The church must be located in a desirable part of the city. The purchase of a suitable lot and the erection of a plain but large, well-ventilated, and skillfully constructed 
                                                                           30
building--something that will stand as an object lesson of neatness and thoroughness--will require a considerable sum.
